channel.title: Black Laptop Screen
channel.description: I got home today and my Asus G1S's screen was black, when I reboot it lights up with the backlight but stays black, no boot screen, no grub, no nothing. I have taken out the battery and waited a few hours but it still does the same thing. Any ideas?

item.title: Black Laptop Screen
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:19, topic:285118”]try taking the graphics card out, and put it in your oven for a few minutes

edit: http://www.engadget.com/2009/05/30/nvidia-gpu-resurrected-after-10-minutes-at-425-f/[/quote]

It’s onboard, since it’s a laptop. Guess I could put the whole motherboard in the oven, as they said in that article, nothing to lose.

It won’t come on at all now, not even when I plug it into a monitor. It seems to boot fine but no dice when it comes to seeing anything.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Laptop Screen
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

That doesn’t look like a driver error; more of a hardware issue. Btw, nice KDE 3.5.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Laptop Screen
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

try taking the graphics card out, and put it in your oven for a few minutes

edit: http://www.engadget.com/2009/05/30/nvidia-gpu-resurrected-after-10-minutes-at-425-f/

Read full topic

item.title: Black Laptop Screen
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:17, topic:285118”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=376818.msg2840657#msg2840657 date=1245949411]
Right after I posted my last post, the laptop screen turned all different colors and the computer locked up, I rebooted a few times before the screen started working again, and it failed again shortly after logging in.

It seems strange, but I am thinking it may have been a driver problem, possibly the day before the first failure I installed the latest 185.18.14 from nvidia as an upgrade to the 180.44 driver that I was running. Now I have reverted back to the old driver and haven’t had a problem since. Has anyone else ever had a driver cause actual hardware failure temporarily? Strange as hell…
[/quote]
well if drivers are an operating system thing, then why would a bad driver make the screen black at boot?[/quote]

Exactly, it shouldn’t happen unless the driver is making the card overheat or something strange.

Once since my last post the screen went into what looked like 256 color mode, flashed about 10 times and then went back to normal. Otherwise everything is working good, but it seems like a hardware failure is imminent.

edit: Messed up again, this sucks.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Laptop Screen
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:16, topic:285118”]Right after I posted my last post, the laptop screen turned all different colors and the computer locked up, I rebooted a few times before the screen started working again, and it failed again shortly after logging in.

It seems strange, but I am thinking it may have been a driver problem, possibly the day before the first failure I installed the latest 185.18.14 from nvidia as an upgrade to the 180.44 driver that I was running. Now I have reverted back to the old driver and haven’t had a problem since. Has anyone else ever had a driver cause actual hardware failure temporarily? Strange as hell…[/quote]
well if drivers are an operating system thing, then why would a bad driver make the screen black at boot?

Read full topic

item.title: Black Laptop Screen
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Right after I posted my last post, the laptop screen turned all different colors and the computer locked up, I rebooted a few times before the screen started working again, and it failed again shortly after logging in.

It seems strange, but I am thinking it may have been a driver problem, possibly the day before the first failure I installed the latest 185.18.14 from nvidia as an upgrade to the 180.44 driver that I was running. Now I have reverted back to the old driver and haven’t had a problem since. Has anyone else ever had a driver cause actual hardware failure temporarily? Strange as hell…

Read full topic

item.title: Black Laptop Screen
item.dc:creator: @tebuddy tebuddy
item.description:
@tebuddy wrote:

Spontaneous failure is usually an indicator of future problems.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Laptop Screen
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

OK…

Just dug out a VGA monitor, hooked it up, turned on the laptop and the screen works now. I’m posting from it. That was strange, hope it doesn’t happen again.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Laptop Screen
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

T4_:

Try hooking the monitor output to another monitor? If it still doesn’t work it’s possibly a dead motherboard.

yeah, if you have a vga port try connecting a monitor to it, then you could probably tell if its a fucked graphics card or its something else
i think

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Black Laptop Screen
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’ve taken apart and fixed quite a few laptops, in fact this acer that I’m on right now had a black screen similar to this, except no backlight on the acer, where as the backlight on the asus is on which makes me think the connection is good.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Laptop Screen
item.dc:creator: @tebuddy tebuddy
item.description:
@tebuddy wrote:

If your comfortable with your computer hardware and no longer have a warranty you could always open it up and check for loose or broken connections. Its not too difficult, but it will void your warranty if you try to return it half taken apart and messed up.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Laptop Screen
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Yes, it also boots all the way into linux just fine because I can ‘sudo poweroff’ and it will shut down. I’m just ‘blind’.

Ah I assumed it wasn’t booting Sounds like screen or vid card death then, fun stuff

Read full topic

item.title: Black Laptop Screen
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Niall:

Do the num/scroll/caps light up?

Yes, it also boots all the way into linux just fine because I can ‘sudo poweroff’ and it will shut down. I’m just ‘blind’.

Mopman:

You’ve tried resetting the CMOS I assume? (Unplug the cmos battery from the motherboard, leave it a while, replug, or hunt for the jumper)

Good idea, I’ll give it a shot.

Read full topic
